text: The 1934–35 season was the 62nd season of competitive football in Scotland and the 45th season of the Scottish Football League. == Scottish League Division One == Champions: Rangers Relegated: St Mirren, Falkirk == Scottish League Division Two == Promoted: Third Lanark, Arbroath == Scottish Cup == Division One champions Rangers were winners of the Scottish Cup final after a 2–1 final win over Hamilton Academical. == Other Honours == === National === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup – North |Clachnacuddin |2 – 0 |Rosyth Dockyard Rec |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup – South |Beith |2 – 1 replay |Bo'ness |} === County === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Aberdeenshire Cup |Peterhead |2 – 1 * |Huntly |- |align=left|Ayrshire Cup |Kilmarnock |11 – 3 * |Ayr United |- |align=left|Dumbartonshire Cup |Vale Ocaba |4 – 1 # |Dumbarton |- |align=left|East of Scotland Shield |Hibernian |4 – 2 |Hearts |- |align=left|Fife Cup |Cowdenbeath |2 – 1 |Dunfermline Athletic |- |align=left|Forfarshire Cup |Dundee |1 – 0 # |Arbroath |- |align=left|Glasgow Cup |Partick Thistle |1 – 0 |Rangers |- |align=left|Lanarkshire Cup |Airdrie |5 – 3 * |Albion Rovers |- |align=left|Perthshire Cup |Blairgowrie |3 – 1play off |Vale of Atholl |- |align=left|Renfrewshire Cup |Morton |4 – 0 |St Mirren |- |align=left|Southern Counties Cup |Queen of the South | | |- |align=left|Stirlingshire Cup |Falkirk |9 – 3 * |King's Park |} * * - aggregate over two legs * # - replay === Highland League === == Junior Cup == Tranent were winners of the Junior Cup after a 6–1 win over Petershill in the final. == Scotland national team == {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents ! !Competition !Scotland scorer(s) |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |20 October 1934 |Windsor Park, Belfast (A) | |align=center|1–2 |BHC |Patrick Gallacher |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |21 November 1934 |Ninian Park, Cardiff (A) | |align=center|3–2 |BHC |Charles Napier (2), Dally Duncan |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |6 April 1935 |Hampden Park, Glasgow (H) | |align=center|2–0 |BHC |Dally Duncan (2) |} Key: * (H) = Home match * (A) = Away match * BHC = British Home Championship == Notes and references == == External links == * Scottish Football Historical Archive Category:Seasons in Scottish football
title: 1934–35 in Scottish football
